Figure 1:The VLA‚Äôs internal features capture high-level information about task success and failure. When the VLA is failing, even though from different tasks, the features fall in the same ‚Äúfailure zone‚Äù. This motivatesSAFE, an efficient multitask failure detector that is based on VLA internal features and can generalize to unseen tasks.
Plot (a) visualizes latent features ofœÄ0subscriptùúã0\pi_{0}italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-FAST on LIBERO-10[20]using t-SNE[21]. For successful rollouts, their features are colored in blue; for failed rollouts, features are colored in the blue-red gradient based on timesteps.
Plot (b) visualizes the same set of t-SNE features, colored by task ID. In (c), we show two example rollouts over time and mark their corresponding projected features in (a) and (b).
Figure 2:Illustration of real-world experiment setup (left) and example rollouts collected (right).

Figure 3:Performance of functional CP by varying significant levelŒ±ùõº\alphaitalic_Œ±onùíüeval-unseensubscriptùíüeval-unseen\mathcal{D}_{\text{eval-unseen}}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT eval-unseen end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The plots show the change of balanced accuracy (bal-acc) w.r.t. average detection time (T-det). Good failure detection methods should detect policy failures both accurately (high bal-acc) and proactively (lower T-det), and thus place curves towards the top left in each plot. We can see in all simulation experiments, the proposedSAFE-LSTM andSAFE-MLP perform better or on par with the best baselines. Note that baselines ingrayrequire multiple action samples.

Figure 4:Failure scores predicted bySAFE-LSTM and the corresponding camera observations. The green areas show the functional CP bandCŒ±subscriptùê∂ùõºC_{\alpha}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Once failure scores exceedCŒ±subscriptùê∂ùõºC_{\alpha}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, a failure flag is raised.
In (a),œÄ0subscriptùúã0\pi_{0}italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-FAST policy misses the insertion, and its actions become unstable after that. In (b) and (c), OpenVLA andœÄ0‚àósuperscriptsubscriptùúã0\pi_{0}^{*}italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPTmiss the grasp but still proceed to the placing action, causing a failure detection. Note that these tasks are not seen when trainingSAFE-LSTM.
Figure 5:Quantitative results (a) and qualitative examples (b-e) fromSAFE-MLP in the real world experiments. The ROC-AUC results are averaged over 5 random seeds with different task splits.
Figure 6:Example successful and failed rollouts from real-world experiments.
